Ask HN: What if AGI isn't that close?
text:
What if transformer models are the totally wrong approach? What if we're about to spend ten years iterating on a fancy parlor trick? We might invent something that almost seems like AGI but really it's just calling a bunch of APIs invented (and maintained) by humans.

What should we have spent the last ten years researching instead?

title: A remotely operated lab is taking shape 2.5 km under the sea
West Virginia's 70s Automated Personal Rapid Transit
Human Brain isn't just electricity signals but then LLM is just token predictor?
text:
Given a benchmarking standard, LLM has shown decent intellectual and cognitive abilities.

Tasks being done by human that cannot be expressed within 1000 lines of if-then code, are now being accomplished by LLM.

Is LLM actually a legit proof to show that human brain is just as simple as a bunch of electricity signals flowing around, as now we can replicate certain amount of functionalities?

Is the judgement for LLM consistent with human brain's?

title: Ask HN: What do you read to quench your thirst for meaning or curiosity?
text:
I have been reading a lot of Paul Graham's essays. They make me think. I learn and adopt to the wise ideas he lays out in a lot of influential articles. They almost always elicit a sense of wonder.

I also came across Paul Buchheit's piece called 'The Technology' (http://paulbuchheit.blogspot.com/2014/07/the-technology.html). It was a fascinating read too and when I finished reading it, I left with a sense of having learnt something meaningful.

I am curious to know if that resonates with HN crowd too. What else do you all read that imprints a deep sense of purpose, meaning or value. I really do not mean 'self-help' category.
